descriptions: Does not correctly name any shapes, regardless of orientation or size.
Correctly names only the most basic shapes (square, circle, triangle) in standard orientations.
Correctly names basic shapes and some other shapes (rectangle, hexagon) but struggles with variations in orientation or size.
Correctly identifies most shapes, including variations in orientation and size, with occasional errors.
Consistently and correctly names almost all shapes, demonstrating a strong understanding of geometric properties.
Perfectly names all shapes, regardless of orientation, size, or complexity, demonstrating comprehensive understanding.
Unable to identify shapes in real-world objects or contexts.
Can identify very basic shapes in simple, obvious real-world examples.
Identifies basic and some other shapes in straightforward real-world contexts, but struggles with more complex examples.
Applies knowledge of shapes to identify them in a variety of real-world contexts with some prompting.
Demonstrates the ability to identify shapes in complex real-world contexts with limited prompting.
Independently and accurately identifies shapes in complex and abstract real-world contexts, demonstrating a deep understanding of shape properties and their application.
